meta.title: Home - Chartiers Valley School District

li.a: Assistant Superintendent of Curriculum and Assessment
Assistant Superintendent of Curriculum and Assessment

img.alt: girl walking through gymnasium for graduation
superintendentat desk with kids in in classroom

div.class: fsElement fsCalendar fsSlideshow home-calendar fsItemCount_9 fsSlideshowHorizontal

div.a: School Board Meeting and Finance Committee Meeting, via Zoom video conference

div.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsGrid home-news fsThumbnailRectangle fsThumbnailXLarge fsItemCount_6

div.title: logo for US news and world report Best High Schools 2020

img.alt: logo for US news and world report Best High Schools 2020

div.a: US News & World Report Ranks CV Among Best High Schools in Country

div.p: U.S. News and World Report released its 2020 high school rankings on Tuesday.

div.title: LOGO - 2020 best communities for music education NAMM

img.alt: LOGO - 2020 best communities for music education NAMM

div.a: Music Programs Earn National Distinction from NAMM Foundation

div.p: For the second consecutive year, CVSD has been selected as one of the nation's Best Communities for Music Education by the NAMM Foundation.

div.a: Senior Citizens "Dinner & A Show" Event CANCELED

div.p: The Chartiers Valley School District invites senior citizens (ages 65+) to attend the opening night of its award-winning productions, free of charge with a CV Gold Card or valid ID!

div.div:
Advanced Placement
Course Offerings with
814 students enrolled

div.p:

among culturally diverse
student population

Bachelors degrees in
credits earned in high school
by the class of 2019

div.div:
National ranking of
curriculum-supported
dance program

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window

div.p: On Thursday, April 20, 2020, Governor Tom Wolf and PA Secretary of Health Dr. Rachel Levine extended the state-wide school closure through the remainder of the academic year (governor.pa.gov).
CVSD schools and facilities will remain closed, and the District will continue to move forward with the Continuity of Education Plan.
Please visit the COVID-19 Information page under the COVID-19 tab for the April 20, 2020 letter from Superintendent Dr. Vanatta regarding prom and graduation.
